intro: Achillea amoena, commonly known as the sweet yarrow, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves and clusters of small, white to pale pink flowers. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and prefers well-drained soils in full sun. Its flowers bloom from late spring to early autumn, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Achillea amoena is often used in herbal medicine for its purported diuretic and anti-inflammatory properties.
